parameters.name: chatId
parameters.description: The id of the chat to which the content belongs. Must be provided for contents which belong to a chat.

201.description: Magic table sheet has been successfully ingested

parameters.name: scopeId
parameters.description: The scope id of the folder to retrieve. It is optional if folderPath is provided. If both are provided, scopeId takes precedence.

parameters.name: folderPath
parameters.description: The path of the folder to retrieve. It is optional if scopeId is provided.

parameters.name: parentId
parameters.description: Parent Id of the folders. If not provided, it will return root folders.

parameters.name: take
parameters.description: The number of results to return.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of results to skip.

parameters.name: recursive
parameters.description: Recursively delete the folder, subfolders and their contents. Defaults to false

get.description: This endpoint proxies requests to OpenAI, supporting all their APIs. Use this to securely access OpenAI via Unique. This is experimentalplease provide feedback. See the official OpenAI docs for routes and parameters.

post.description: This endpoint proxies requests to OpenAI, supporting all their APIs. Use this to securely access OpenAI via Unique. This is experimentalplease provide feedback. See the official OpenAI docs for routes and parameters.

put.description: This endpoint proxies requests to OpenAI, supporting all their APIs. Use this to securely access OpenAI via Unique. This is experimentalplease provide feedback. See the official OpenAI docs for routes and parameters.

delete.description: This endpoint proxies requests to OpenAI, supporting all their APIs. Use this to securely access OpenAI via Unique. This is experimentalplease provide feedback. See the official OpenAI docs for routes and parameters.

patch.description: This endpoint proxies requests to OpenAI, supporting all their APIs. Use this to securely access OpenAI via Unique. This is experimentalplease provide feedback. See the official OpenAI docs for routes and parameters.

options.description: This endpoint proxies requests to OpenAI, supporting all their APIs. Use this to securely access OpenAI via Unique. This is experimentalplease provide feedback. See the official OpenAI docs for routes and parameters.

head.description: This endpoint proxies requests to OpenAI, supporting all their APIs. Use this to securely access OpenAI via Unique. This is experimentalplease provide feedback. See the official OpenAI docs for routes and parameters.

search.description: This endpoint proxies requests to OpenAI, supporting all their APIs. Use this to securely access OpenAI via Unique. This is experimentalplease provide feedback. See the official OpenAI docs for routes and parameters.

info.title: Unique Public API
info.description: Public API for Unique platform - Chat, Content, and AI services

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when assessment was last updated

userId.description: User ID who created the assessment

isVisible.description: Whether assessment is visible to users

createdBy.description: ID of the user who created this assessment

completedAt.description: Timestamp when message processing was completed

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when message was last updated

references.description: References and citations used in the message

assessment.description: Assessments and evaluations of the message

deleted.description: Indicates if the object was deleted

name.description: The name of the function to be called.

description.description: A description of what the function does.

parameters.description: The parameters the functions accepts, described as a JSON Schema object.

name.description: The name of the response format. Must be a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or contain underscores and dashes, with a maximum length of 64.

description.description: A description of what the response format is for, used by the model to determine how to respond in the format.

schema.description: The schema for the response format, described as a JSON Schema object.

strict.description: Whether to enable strict schema adherence when generating the output.

json_schema.description: The JSON Schema for the response format.

name.description: The name of the function to call.

functions.description: A list of functions the model may generate JSON inputs for.

function_call.description: Controls how the model responds to function calls.

max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate.

temperature.description: The sampling temperature to use that controls the apparent creativity of generated completions.

top_p.description: An alternative to sampling with temperature called nucleus sampling.

logit_bias.description: A map between GPT token IDs and bias scores that influences the probability of specific tokens appearing in a completions response.

user.description: An identifier for the caller or end user of the operation.

n.description: The number of chat completions choices that should be generated for a chat completions response.

stop.description: A collection of textual sequences that will end completions generation.

presence_penalty.description: A value that influences the probability of generated tokens appearing based on their existing presence in generated text.

frequency_penalty.description: A value that influences the probability of generated tokens appearing based on their cumulative frequency in generated text.

seed.description: If specified, the system will make a best effort to sample deterministically.

response_format.description: An object specifying the format that the model must output. Used to enable JSON mode.

tools.description: The available tool definitions that the chat completions request can use, including caller-defined functions.

tool_choice.description: If specified, the model will configure which of the provided tools it can use for the chat completions response.

texts.description: Array of texts to create embeddings for

chunkId.description: Chunk ID this result is from

text.description: Text content of the search result

updatedAt.description: When the content was last updated

startPage.description: Starting page number in the document

endPage.description: Ending page number in the document

contains.description: Filter condition that matches if the field contains the specified string.

endsWith.description: Filter condition that matches if the field ends with the specified string.

equals.description: Filter condition that matches if the field is equal to the specified string.

gt.description: Filter condition that matches if the field is greater than the specified string.

gte.description: Filter condition that matches if the field is greater than or equal to the specified string.

in.description: Filter condition that matches if the field is within the specified list of strings.

lt.description: Filter condition that matches if the field is less than the specified string.

lte.description: Filter condition that matches if the field is less than or equal to the specified string.

not.description: Negation of the current filter. Can be used to specify a condition that should not match.

notIn.description: Filter condition that matches if the field is not within the specified list of strings.

startsWith.description: Filter condition that matches if the field starts with the specified string.

lt.description: Filter condition that matches if the field is less than the specified string.

lte.description: Filter condition that matches if the field is less than or equal to the specified string.

mode.description: Specifies the mode for string comparison.

not.description: Filter condition for all properties except this one.

where.description: Filters to apply on the content search.

chatId.description: The chat ID related to the search query.

includeFailedContent.description: Whether to include failed content in the search results.

metadataFilter.description: UniqueQL metadata filters to apply on the content search. If filePath or content id are provided, metadataFilter will be ignored.

filePath.description: The file path of the content. If filePath or content id are provided, metadataFilter will be ignored.

contentId.description: The id of the content. If filePath or content id are provided, metadataFilter will be ignored.

chatId.description: The id of the chat. This is mandatory if the file is part of a chat

take.description: The number of results to return. When filePath is provided, default is 1.

skip.description: The number of results to skip.

totalCount.description: The total count of folder infos.

metadataFilter.description: UniqueQL metadata filters to apply for advanced content search. This filter is mutually exclusive with parentId: only one should be provided per request. If parentId is set, metadataFilter must be omitted.

parentId.description: Parent Id for hierarchical content search. If provided, metadataFilter must be omitted. If not provided, root contents are returned.

take.description: The number of results to return.

skip.description: The number of results to skip.

totalCount.description: The total count of folder infos.

type.description: The data type of the column.

identifying.description: Indicates whether the column is an identifying attribute of the table.

displayed.description: Indicates whether the column is displayed in the table.

tableFileName.description: The file name of the table configuration.

columns.description: An array of column configurations for the table.

rowFilter.description: A filter string to apply to the rows of the table.

repeatingTable.description: The name of the repeating table structure.

header.description: The header content for the table.

footer.description: The footer content for the table.

noDataFound.description: The message displayed when no data is found for the table.

query.description: The SQL query string to be executed for retrieving table data.

tableConfig.description: The configuration object for the table that includes columns, filters, and other settings.

templateName.description: The name of the template to be used for the export.

scopeId.description: The identifier of the scope within which the export is performed.

data.description: The data to be included in the export.

resultingFilename.description: The filename that will be used for the resulting exported file.

columnName.description: Human-readable name or label for the column.

content.description: The actual data or value stored in this column for the given row.

columns.description: List of columns and their values for this row.

columnIdsInMetadata.description: Column IDs to be included in the metadata.

columnIdsInChunkText.description: Column IDs to be included in the content chunk.

data.description: Array of table rows, each containing columns and their values.

ingestionConfiguration.description: Configuration for how columns are used in metadata and content.

metadata.description: Optional generic JSON object with additional metadata.

scopeId.description: Scope identifier for the ingestion context.

sheetName.description: The name of the sheet used to compose the content key. If not provided, the libraryName from metadata will be used.

rowId.description: The ID of the row from the magic table sheet

contentId.description: The ID of the created content

rowIdsToContentIds.description: Array of mappings between row IDs and their corresponding content IDs

id.description: Unique identifier for the search result.

chunkId.description: Identifier of the chunk containing the search result.

key.description: Key associated with the search result.

internallyStoredAt.description: Timestamp when the search result was stored internally.

searchContext.description: Available search results that can be added as references to the message. This happens automatically in case a [source<NUMBER>] is found in the streamed text.
Available search results that can be added as references to the message. This happens automatically in case a [source<NUMBER>] is found in the streamed text.

contentId.description: Content ID this chunk belongs to

updatedAt.description: When the chunk was last updated

order.description: Order of the chunk in the document

data.description: Array of chunk creation result objects

name.description: Name of the magic table sheet

chatId.description: Chat ID associated with this sheet

createdBy.description: User ID who created the sheet

companyId.description: Company ID associated with the sheet

magicTableCells.description: Array of cells in this sheet

magicTableRowCount.description: Total number of rows in the sheet

rowOrders.description: Array of row order numbers to update

status.description: Status to set for the rows

numberOfEmptyCells.description: Number of empty cells to create. Only needed if the magic table sheet has no columns.

sheetId.description: The id of the magic table sheet

cellIds.description: Array of correctly ordered cell IDs associated with this magic table row

data.description: The data to update the magic table cell with

name.description: The name of the MCP tool to call

arguments.description: Arguments to pass to the MCP tool

type.description: The type of content returned by the tool

content.description: Array of content items returned by the tool

isError.description: Whether the tool call was successful

mcpServerId.description: The ID of the MCP server that processed the tool call

name.description: The name of the tool that was called

updatedAt.description: When the assessment was last updated
When the execution was last updated

createdAt.description: The date when the folder was created.

updatedAt.description: The date when the folder was last updated.

externalId.description: The external id of the folder.

ingestionConfig.description: The ingestion config of the folder.

paths.description: An array of paths to validate

parentId.description: The ID of the parent scope

ScopeAccessEntityType.description: Type of the Scope Access Entity

scopeAccesses.description: Scope accesses to add to the folder and its subfolders.

applyToSubScopes.description: If true, the scope access will be added to all subfolders.

id.description: The id of the folder whose access was updated.

name.description: The name of the folder whose access was updated.

scopeId.description: The scope id of the folder to retrieve. It is optional if folderPath is provided. If both are provided, scopeId takes precedence.

folderPath.description: The path of the folder to retrieve. It is optional if scopeId is provided.

scopeAccesses.description: Scope accesses to add to the folder and its subfolders.

applyToSubScopes.description: If true, the scope access will be added to all subfolders.

scopeAccesses.description: Scope accesses to add to the folder and its subfolders.

applyToSubScopes.description: If true, the scope access will be removed from all subfolders.

scopeId.description: The scope id of the folder to retrieve. It is optional if folderPath is provided. If both are provided, scopeId takes precedence.

folderPath.description: The path of the folder to retrieve. It is optional if scopeId is provided.

scopeAccesses.description: Scope accesses to add to the folder and its subfolders.

applyToSubScopes.description: If true, the scope access will be removed from all subfolders.
If true, the scope access will be added to all subfolders.

id.description: The id of the folder whose ingestion config was updated.

name.description: The name of the folder whose ingestion config was updated.

scopeId.description: The scope id of the folder to retrieve. It is optional if folderPath is provided. If both are provided, scopeId takes precedence.

folderPath.description: The path of the folder to retrieve. It is optional if scopeId is provided.

applyToSubScopes.description: If true, the scope access will be added to all subfolders.

parentId.description: The scope id of the new parent folder. It is optional and can be null for the root folder. Should be set when moving a folder.

name.description: The new name of the folder. It is optional.

role.description: The role is always USER for this endpoint.

scopeRules.description: UniqueQL scope rules to apply on the message

messageId.description: Message ID this log belongs to

status.description: Current status of the message log

updatedAt.description: When the log was last updated

contentType.description: Single content type to filter by
